instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello I need help how to solve this problem.Te escribo español hacerme entender.El pad <SIGNAL>SMC_TM</SIGNAL> se daño por corrosion, por lo tanto.Yo hago un puente desde <RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR> al pin smc pin10.Sin embargo el pad <SIGNAL>SMC_TM</SIGNAL> tambien va al pin 9 J6100, como hago para llegar desde el pad <SIGNAL>SMC_TM</SIGNAL> hasta J6100? tambien me puedes indicar que significa la linea azul que sale del pad <SIGNAL>SMC_TM</SIGNAL> del boardview .Muchas gracias, adjunto imagenes[ATTACH type="full"]60619[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full"]60620[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No need to route <SIGNAL>SMC_TMS</SIGNAL> to J6100.
You can even remove J6100, if you note it corroded.

No hace falta llevar <SIGNAL>SMC_TMS</SIGNAL> hasta J6100.
Puedes incluso quitar J6100, si lo notas corroido.

Por cierto, usa OpenBoardView; free tu download from Internet.
Las capturas de arriba se parecen mas a cuadros de Picasso que a boardview...
